mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Thomas Jefferson Building was built between 1890 and 1897. It was originally known as the Library of Congress Building and is located on First Street SE, between Independence Avenue and East Capitol Street in Washington, D.C. The Beaux-Arts style building is known for its classicizing facade and elaborately decorated interior. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Jefferson_Building Beginning in 1892, a new architect, Edward Pearce Casey . . . began to supervise the interior work, including sculptural and painted decoration by more than 50 American artists. --http://myloc.gov/ExhibitSpaces/jeffbuilding/Pages/BriefHistory.aspx [work]
